title: How to Get a Little Healthier While Staying Just as Lazy

steps.title: Eat your meals with your nondominant hand.
steps.content: Eat your meals with your nondominant hand. If you’re right-handed, put your fork in your left hand at meals. Using your nondominant hand as your fork hand makes you eat more slowly. Stop eating when you feel full, but not bloated. You’ll eat more slowly and probably consume less food. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add in healthy food.
steps.content: Add in healthy food. Buy those Milano cookies, but also make an effort to buy frozen fruit for smoothies and snap pea crisps to snack on, too. Over time, try to eat fewer cookies and more of the healthy snacks you have on hand.

steps.title: Drink a glass of water before every meal.
steps.content: Drink a glass of water before every meal. Water will fill you up a little bit, so you won’t overeat at your next meal. Make it a habit to keep a water bottle near you at all times, whether you’re in your house or on the go. [2] X Trustworthy Source Arthritis Foundation Main organization devoted to arthritis support and education Go to source

steps.title: Drink coffee.
steps.content: Drink coffee. People who drink three to five cups of coffee a day are less likely to show early symptoms of heart disease. Don’t skip out of your morning cup of coffee or that afternoon pick me up. [3] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source

steps.title: Eat on smaller plates.
steps.content: Eat on smaller plates. People who eat on smaller plates end up eating less food. Buy a few inexpensive smaller plates and bowls if yours are large. You’ll think you’ve eaten more than you have. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Eat spicy foods.
steps.content: Eat spicy foods. Spicy foods may help to decrease your appetite. Go for extra hot salsa, some chili peppers, or cayenne pepper. Add it to your food for extra flavor and a health boost! [5] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Walk for two minutes every hour.
steps.content: Walk for two minutes every hour. Just two minutes...you can do it! You can even walk in circles around your couch while you watch TV. Walking will help you burn extra calories that would have been stored as fat, had you stayed sitting. [6] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source

steps.title: Walk backwards.
steps.content: Walk backwards. Be sure to look behind you. Walking backwards, even in short bursts, may have huge health benefits. Walking backwards will also work different muscles than walking forwards. [7] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source

steps.title: Get your metabolism started early.
steps.content: Get your metabolism started early. If you have things to do, such as laundry, taking out the trash, or other chores, do them earlier rather than later. This will kickstart your metabolism.

steps.title: Stand instead of sit.
steps.content: Stand instead of sit. You can still play video games or watch TV, but try to stand for at least half of the time you’re doing so. You can burn up to 750 more calories every week if you stand for 3 hours a day! [8] X Research source

steps.title: Hit the snooze button.
steps.content: Hit the snooze button. Getting plenty of sleep boosts your immune system , reduces your risk of inflammation, depression, and stress. Plenty of sleep also helps to keep down your weight. It also improves your daily mood, making sure you're taking care of your mental health as well. [9] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source

steps.title: Hang out with your friends.
steps.content: Hang out with your friends. Spending time with friends reduces your stress level and could help you prevent inflammation and keep your blood pressure and heart rate down. Find time to hang out with a friend on weeknights, too, even if you’re exhausted from work or school. It’s healthy! [10] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Watch a funny video during work.
steps.content: Watch a funny video during work. Take a break from your normal workday to watch a funny video of a cat or a puppy. You will have more energy and be happier in the long run! [11] X Research source

steps.title: Pet your dog or cat.
steps.content: Pet your dog or cat. You get the “love hormone,” oxytocin, from just looking at your animal’s face. Spend some quality time with your pet and get a boost of happiness in return. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Park far away.
steps.content: Park far away. Even if you go to get fast food, park at the far end of the parking lot so you have to walk. Walking will burn some more calories and help you exercise even a little bit. [13] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source

steps.title: Play more active games.
steps.content: Play more active games. Instead of playing games that require sitting, like Xbox or PlayStation, try playing a more active game, like Wii Tennis or Dance Dance Revolution. You can also venture out of the house to play paintball or laser tag.
